keyword: calories in a white castle slider
title: Calories in a White Castle Slider
meta_description: Discover calories in a white castle slider, including full nutrition breakdown like protein, carbs, fat, sodium, and easy tweaks for variations.
h1: Calories in a White Castle Slider
assumptions: Standard original White Castle hamburger slider: small steamed beef patty, bun, diced onions, pickles; no modifications.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by location, exact recipe, and customizations. Values based on standard published data; check White Castle app or menu for latest.

quick_answer.text: A standard White Castle slider contains about 140 calories and 6 g protein.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison with packaging.

tweaks.label: Cheese slider variation (cheese instead of plain)

faqs.q: How many calories in a white castle slider?
faqs.a: Approximately 140 calories for the original hamburger slider.

faqs.q: What is the protein in a White Castle slider?
faqs.a: About 6 g of protein per slider.

faqs.q: Are White Castle sliders high in sodium?
faqs.a: Yes, around 380 mg sodium per slider due to seasoning and bun.

faqs.q: How do cheese sliders compare in calories?
faqs.a: Cheese sliders add about 40-50 kcal, totaling around 180-190 kcal.

faqs.q: Does the slider have trans fat?
faqs.a: Yes, approximately 1 g trans fat per slider from the beef patty.
